UAScheduleTrigger Class Reference

Inherits from NSObject
Declared in UAScheduleTrigger.h

Overview

Screen trigger name when defining a trigger in JSON.

Properties

goal

The trigger’s goal. Once the goal is reached it will cause the schedule to execute its actions.

@property (nonatomic, readonly) NSNumber *goal

Class Methods

backgroundTriggerWithCount:

Factory method to create a background trigger.

+ (instancetype)backgroundTriggerWithCount:(NSUInteger)count

Parameters

count

Number of backgrounds before firing the trigger.

Return Value

A background trigger.

Declared In

UAScheduleTrigger.h

customEventTriggerWithPredicate:count:

Factory method to create a custom event count trigger.

+ (instancetype)customEventTriggerWithPredicate:(UAJSONPredicate *)predicate count:(NSUInteger)count

Parameters

predicate

Custom event predicate to filter out events that are applied to the trigger’s count.

count

Number of custom event counts before firing the trigger.

Return Value

A custom event count trigger.

Declared In

UAScheduleTrigger.h

customEventTriggerWithPredicate:value:

Factory method to create a custom event value trigger.

+ (instancetype)customEventTriggerWithPredicate:(UAJSONPredicate *)predicate value:(NSNumber *)value

Parameters

predicate

Custom event predicate to filter out events that are applied to the trigger’s value.

value

Aggregate custom event value before firing the trigger.

Return Value

A custom event value trigger.

UAScheduleTrigger.h

triggerWithJSON:error:

Factory method to create a trigger from a JSON payload.

+ (nullable instancetype)triggerWithJSON:(id)json error:(NSError *_Nullable *)error

Parameters

json

The JSON payload.

error

An NSError pointer for storing errors, if applicable.

Return Value

A trigger or nil if the JSON is invalid.

Instance Methods

isEqualToTrigger:

Checks if the trigger is equal to another trigger.

- (BOOL)isEqualToTrigger:(nullable UAScheduleTrigger *)trigger

Parameters

trigger

The other trigger info to compare against.

Return Value

YES if the triggers are equal, otherwise NO.
